article: Tired of the hassle of setting up and managing virtual machines?  Meet lume, the macOS and Linux VM manager that's about to revolutionize your workflow! This powerful command-line interface (CLI) and local API server simplifies the entire process, letting you create, run, and manage VMs with incredible ease.  Forget wrestling with complex configurations; lume handles the heavy lifting, allowing you to focus on what matters most: your code.  Built using Apple's Virtualization.Framework, lume delivers near-native performance on Apple Silicon, making it a perfect companion for developers working on macOS.  But it's not just about speed; lume is also incredibly user-friendly. Its intuitive commands make it a breeze to create new VMs, specifying resources like CPU cores, memory, and disk size with simple flags. Want to run a pre-built macOS image?  Just one command is all it takes!  Need to share files between your host machine and the VM? lume makes that simple too.  And for those who prefer a more programmatic approach, lume's Python interface, pylume, provides even greater control and automation possibilities.  Beyond the CLI, lume also includes a local API server, opening up a world of integration options.  Imagine scripting your entire VM lifecycle, from creation to deletion, all within your favorite automation framework. This level of control and flexibility is unparalleled in the world of VM management.  lume's versatility extends to various use cases. Whether you're a developer testing applications across multiple operating systems, a system administrator managing virtual environments, or simply someone who wants a streamlined way to run VMs, lume is the tool for you.  It supports both macOS and Linux VMs, giving you the flexibility you need to work with a wide range of technologies and applications. The project also boasts a vibrant community, readily available through their Discord server, ready to offer support and guidance.  This collaborative environment ensures that you're never truly alone when working with lume.  In short, lume is more than just a VM manager; it's a comprehensive solution that streamlines your workflow, enhances productivity, and empowers you to focus on what truly matters: building amazing software.  It's fast, efficient, user-friendly, and backed by a supportive community. What more could you ask for?
key_takeaways: Effortless macOS and Linux VM management via CLI and API
Near-native performance on Apple Silicon using Virtualization.Framework
Simplified VM creation and configuration with intuitive commands
Seamless file sharing between host and VM
title: lume: Effortless macOS and Linux VM Management
readme_summary: Lume is a command-line interface and API server that leverages Apple's Virtualization.Framework to provide efficient macOS and Linux VM management on Apple Silicon.  It offers features such as creating, running, configuring, and deleting VMs, along with the ability to pull pre-built images and interact programmatically via its API server.
description: A lightweight CLI and local API server to create, run and manage macOS and Linux virtual machines (VMs) natively on Apple Silicon.
